articles.title: ‘Grave crime, societal impact’: HC’s denial of relief to Kuldeep Senger in Unnao custodial death case
articles.summary: This marks Senger’s second failed attempt to seek suspension of sentence in the case. A similar plea was dismissed by the Delhi High Court earlier on 7 June 2024.

articles.title: A cancer-sniffing worm hits legal hurdle in India due to patent red tape
articles.summary: Why the Delhi High Court rejected a Japanese firm's application for a patent on cancer detection using worms with an acute sense of smell.

articles.title: Dadri lynching case: After UP govt bid to withdraw charges rejected, Noida court to decide transfer plea
articles.summary: UP govt plea claims current judge in fast-track court not hearing them properly. Court's decision on 22 January will decide if case will be shifted to another court.

articles.title: From Ram Janmabhoomi to Ram Setu: RSS legal arm Adhivakta Parishad is everywhere, but nowhere
articles.summary: From shaping courtroom battles to mentoring future judges, the Adhivakta Parishad operates as the Sangh’s quiet legal force—visible in verdicts, absent on paper.

articles.title: Delhi Bar Council has rarely had women members before. This time, the mould is ready to break
articles.summary: Women candidates' entry after SC's reservation direction has changed the contest. In corridors that once assumed leadership was male-dominated, women are claiming their space.

articles.title: How Ukraine war brought a $2.2 bn-dollar dispute between Russian company & Italian firm to Bombay HC
articles.summary: EuroChem's Russian unit has staked claim to assets worth Rs 19,598 crore, belonging to Tecnimont, part of Italy’s MAIRE group, in India.

articles.title: Firm wouldn’t exist without you—HC snub to Marion Biotech directors in Uzbekistan cough syrup deaths
articles.summary: Marion Biotech is the Noida-based manufacturer of DOK-I Max cough syrup, which was linked to the deaths of at least 18 children in Uzbekistan in 2022.

articles.title: ‘No illegality’: SC rejects Justice Yashwant Varma’s plea, clears way for Lok Sabha inquiry panel
articles.summary: Justice Varma 'is not entitled to any relief' and 'no interference' by the court 'is called for,' a bench of Justices Dipankar Dutta and SC Sharma says.

articles.title: Centre comes out in support of passive euthanasia in SC, backs parents’ plea to let son die with dignity
articles.summary: Withdrawal of futile treatment is not 'killing', Centre argues. SC reserves verdict on withdrawing life support to 31-year-old.

articles.title: ED-Jharkhand Police face-off: HC raps cops, stays probe in assault case against agency officers
articles.summary: There was heavy police deployment outside Ranchi ED office Thursday. Some cops 'collected service records' of 2 officers facing allegation of assaulting ex-govt employee.

articles.title: From makeshift structures to modern courts—10 UP districts to get integrated judicial complexes
articles.summary: CJI to lay foundation of Rs 1,630-cr Phase 1 of project that envisages futuristic court complexes with conference hall, residences, gym, advocate chambers, waiting rooms   latest tech.

articles.title: ‘Substance over form’: How SC’s Tiger Global-Flipkart ruling on tax treaties sets crucial precedent
articles.summary: Supreme Court rules that Mauritius entities were 'conduits' in US firm Tiger Global's Flipkart exit in 2018; decision could force foreign investors to re-examine their holdings.

articles.title: Yahoo yodel to Taj Hotels’ signature sonic sound, how the law protects unconventional trademarks
articles.summary: Tata Group-owned IHCL has secured a sound mark registration for the 'Taj sonic sound', marking a significant milestone in the evolution of unconventional trademarks in the country.

articles.title: In departure from many past court orders, Gujarat HC flags bodily autonomy in a marital rape case
articles.summary: The high court has upheld a trial court's denial of anticipatory bail to a man, whose wife has accused him and her in-laws of rape, unnatural sex, and physical assault, calling her accusations 'serious'.

articles.title: ED vs Mamata: SC says dispute ‘serious’, seeks Bengal CM’s response on ‘interference’ in I-PAC raid
articles.summary: ED plea has urged SC to order CBI probe into ‘intrusion’ by Bengal government   its head in its money laundering probe against I-PAC, which provides political consultancy services to TMC.

articles.title: Bitter pill for big pharma: Why Delhi HC upheld Centre’s ban on type 2 diabetes combination drug
articles.summary: Division bench of Delhi HC overturned 2019 order by single-judge bench, restoring ban on manufacture, sale, and distribution of triple-drug combinations for type 2 diabetes.

articles.title: ‘Want your name in Guinness?’ HC raps serial petitioner flagging ‘encroachments’ near mosques
articles.summary: Advocate Umesh Chandra Sharma also represents activist Preet Sirohi who had approached HC against 'encroachments' near Faiz-e-Illahi Mosque in Turkman Gate area.

articles.title: Civil nuclear cooperation, a ride with Modi: UAE President’s whirlwind India visit amid West Asia churn
articles.summary: UAE President arrived for 3-hour visit that saw Abu Dhabi   New Delhi agree to develop a framework for strategic defence partnership, while also concluding long-term purchase agreements for LNG.

articles.title: Polish Deputy PM Sikorski likens India’s Pakistani terror concerns to Russian aggression in Ukraine
articles.summary: Talks between EAM Jaishankar and Polish counterpart continued about an hour past scheduled time, indicating depth of the conversation. Polish Deputy PM also met NSA Ajit Doval.

articles.title: Selective targeting of India ‘unfair, unjustified’: Jaishankar flags US & EU sanctions on Russian oil
articles.summary: Jaishankar makes it clear in meeting with Poland's Radosław Sikorski that India’s issue was not just with US tariffs, but also actions taken by EU to curb purchases of Russian oil.

articles.title: India invited to Trump’s ‘most impressive’ Board of Peace for Gaza. Permanent membership costs $1 billion
articles.summary: Other countries invited include Pakistan, Argentina, Jordan and Canada. Draft charter indicates Board may go beyond Gaza, appoints Donald Trump as chairman until he resigns.

articles.title: 4-yr-old boy ‘locked in dark room, tortured’. Delhi kindergarten horror in French embassy premises
articles.summary: Probe into cruelty allegations against school's directors   staff comes after several weeks of child's mother filing a police complaint, that too only after child rights authorities stepped in.

articles.title: Trump repeats claim of stopping India-Pakistan war, says Shehbaz thanked him for ‘saving lives’
articles.summary: The US President made the remarks at the renaming of Southern Boulevard to Donald J Trump Boulevard. Trump has made similar claims many times since May 10 last year.

articles.title: India, Japan wrap up 18th Strategic Dialogue. Talks focus on critical minerals, UNICORN radar
articles.summary: For Japan, diversification of supply chains is important given its rising tensions with Beijing. For India and Japan, focus on ensuring US engagement in the region, says Japanese spokesperson.

articles.title: EU-India FTA set to be inked on 27 January after years of negotiations. Here’s why it’s important
articles.summary: The European Union is India’s single-largest trading partner when exports and imports with all 27 member-states are calculated. The deal has been almost two decades in the making.

articles.title: New Delhi to evacuate Indian nationals from Iran amid escalating protests
articles.summary: This comes a day after MEA advised Indian nationals to leave Iran by any available means of transport as the situation in the West Asian country continued to spiral.

articles.title: India’s trade deficit with China widens as Beijing hits record $1.2tn trade surplus despite Trump tariffs
articles.summary: China’s exports to India have grown by 13.46 per cent between the first nine months of the 2024-2025 financial year and the 2025-26 financial year, according to the latest trade data.

articles.title: India-China & ASEAN should come together for Panchsheel 2.0, says former Singapore FM
articles.summary: George Yeo was speaking at the 43rd CD Deshmukh Memorial Lecture in Delhi where he spoke about the importance of India-China ties in the Trump era.

articles.title: Trump diplomacy comes to India in a BMW with blue & red lights—Sergio Gor officially takes the reins
articles.summary: As Sergio Gor presents credentials to the President, India has a new US ambassador, a year after Biden appointee Eric Garcetti vacated the post on 19 January 2025.

articles.title: India most important market for us, will continue to invest there: Cisco
articles.summary: Speaking to PTI here during the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting, the company's President and Chief Product Officer said India accounts for the largest concentration of its people outside the US.

articles.title: AI most profound platform shift in human history; every job, workflow will be reconfigured: Cisco
articles.summary: Speaking to PTI here during the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting, the technology giant's President and Chief Product Officer, Jeetu Patel, said every job will get reconfigured, and every workflow is going to change due to AI.

articles.title: Space next big place for data centres: Cisco
articles.summary: Patel, President and Chief Product Officer at Cisco, said while green data centres are going to be very prominent soon, the next few years would witness those centres being built in the space to tackle infrastructure, mainly power, constraints.

articles.title: Lodha Developers to invest $11 billion in 2.5 GW data centre park in Maharashtra
articles.summary: ​India's Lodha ⁠Developers said on Tuesday ‌that it ‌would ‌invest an additional Rs 1 lakh crore ($11 billion) ​to ​build a ‌2.5 ‍gigawatt data ‍centre park in the ‌state of Maharashtra, expanding on an ‍earlier commitment of Rs 30,000 ‍crore.

articles.title: Japan, US narrow first $550 billion investment picks, including SoftBank-linked plan, sources say
articles.summary: The two governments have intensified discussions to select the initial projects ‌under the ‌investment scheme, agreed as part of Tokyo's deal with Washington to lower tariffs on Japanese exports ‌to the United States, the sources said on Monday.

articles.title: Malaysia's Khazanah to steer more capital to power grids, chip firms, chief says in Davos
articles.summary: Surging AI computing needs were reshaping what is "investable" in the AI boom, with energy supply and grid resilience being central to ‌competitiveness, Khazanah ‌Managing Director Amirul Feisal Wan Zahir said in an interview at the World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Davos.

articles.title: Taylor Swift label UMG inks licensing deal with China's NetEase Cloud Music
articles.summary: The ‌multi-year license ‌agreement allows UMG-signed artists like Taylor ‌Swift to stream on NetEase's platform. The deal includes provisions and terms covering artificial intelligence both companies ​said reflect a "shared ​commitment to responsible AI practices ‌that ‍support and protect the ‍music and artists that UMG represents," ‌in a statement announcing the deal.

articles.title: Ecommerce platforms may post 20-22% growth in Republic Day sales
articles.summary: Ecommerce marketplaces such as Amazon India and Flipkart are set to post 20–22% growth during their ongoing Republic Day sales compared with last year, extending the online shopping momentum seen during the 2025 festive season, according to industry experts.

articles.title: Indians face more US visa refusals on social media scrutiny
articles.summary: Indians are facing increasing temporary US visa refusals under section 221(g), with stricter background checks, social media vetting, and scrutiny of old arrest records causing delays. Even applicants with valid documents are affected, and appointments are being pushed to later in the year. The process now requires additional documents, slowing visa approvals further.

articles.title: India must speed up AI upskilling: Coursera cofounder Andrew Ng
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is redrawing the skills map for India’s $280 billion IT services industry, and unless professionals upskill at speed, job disruption could be severe, said AI pioneer Andrew Ng, founder of DeepLearning.AI and cofounder of Coursera. He also cautioned against the swelling hype over AGI, arguing that large language models are not a path to human-level intelligence and that claims of AGI being imminent are misleading.

articles.title: Meta 'turning a blind eye' to illegal gambling ads, UK Gambling Commission says
articles.summary: Britain's Gambling Commission said on Monday that ‍Meta Platforms, the ​owner of Facebook and Instagram, was turning a ⁠blind eye to illegal online casinos advertising on its sites, indicating it was happy to continue taking money from criminals.

articles.title: OpenAI CFO says annualised revenue crosses $20 billion in 2025
articles.summary: OpenAI chief financial officer Sarah Friar ‍said in a blog ​post on Sunday the company's annualized ⁠revenue has surpassed $20 billion in 2025, up from $6 billion in 2024 with growth closely tracking an expansion in computing ‌capacity.

articles.title: WEF 2026: MP govt holds talks with Tech Mahindra president on expanding IT, BPO in tier-II cities
articles.summary: The Government of Madhya Pradesh on Monday interacted with Harshul Asnani, president of Tech Mahindra, to look at entering the state of Madhya Pradesh with a focus on expanding in tier-II cities to deepen access to talent.

articles.title: Kerala: CM Vijayan opens his State’s work-near-home facility at Kollam
articles.summary: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday launched ‘Commune’, the pilot centre of his government’s ambitious work-near-home (WNH) project, which he called an important step towards building Kerala as a thriving skill hub.

articles.title: World Economic Forum 2026: Global tech titans gather at Davos
articles.summary: Tech titans scheduled to be on hand include Jensen Huang of Nvidia. Microsoft's Satya Nadella, Demis Hassabis of Google DeepMind, and Arthur Mensch of France's Mistral AI.

articles.title: UK, France mull social media bans for youth as debate rages
articles.summary: Countries including France and Britain are considering following Australia's lead by banning children and some teenagers from using social media, but experts are still locked in a debate over the effectiveness of the move. France is currently debating bills for a similar ban for under-15s, including one championed by President Emmanuel Macron.

articles.title: Ola Electric CFO Harish Abichandani resigns; Deepak Rastogi appointed successor
articles.summary: Electric ⁠two-wheeler maker Ola Electric on Monday named Deepak Rastogi as its new finance ‌chief, ‌effective January 20. Rastogi, who most ‌recently was the group finance chief of property developer Puravankara, will succeed Harish Abichandani, Ola said.

articles.title: Shadowfax secures Rs 856 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
articles.summary: Logistics firm Shadowfax Technologies has secured approximately Rs 850 crore from anchor investors ahead of its IPO, which opens on January 20. The company has reduced its IPO size to Rs 1,907 crore, with a focus on diversifying its client base towards D2C brands and smaller retailers. Shadowfax reported a 68% rise in operating revenues to Rs 1,805.

articles.title: Trump to meet global CEOs in Davos, with US policy in focus
articles.summary: Business leaders, including CEOs in ‌financial services, crypto and ‌consulting, were invited to a reception after Trump's address to the World Economic Forum's annual meeting. The agenda was unclear.

articles.title: Space sector eyes further investment growth in 2026 after record year
articles.summary: Investors expect the funding momentum to be ‌driven by spending on sovereign satellite and missile-defence systems, integration of AI into space hardware and analytics, and the prospect of a SpaceX IPO, Seraphim Space said. Investments in the ‌sector hit record levels in 2025, with private investment growing 48% to $12.4 billion, including $3.8 billion in the final quarter, according to data from Seraphim Space.

articles.title: ASM International's bookings beat market view as China orders rebound
articles.summary: Europe's second largest chipmaking equipment manufacturer also hiked ‌its guidance for the first quarter of 2026. It now sees a "healthy" revenue increase on a constant currency basis compared to last quarter, having previously forecast a slow ​start to the year.

articles.title: As ChatGPT introduces ads, Google says it has no such plans for Gemini
articles.summary: Senior Google executive Taylor noted that Gemini and search are "complementary tools with different roles." Search, he said, helps users discover new information that "can include commercial interests like new products or services", while "Gemini is your AI assistant" focussed on helping users "create, analyse, and complete" tasks.

articles.title: South Korea's Lee, Italy's Meloni agree to strengthen cooperation in AI, chips
articles.summary: South ⁠Korean President Lee ‌Jae Myung ‌and ‌Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni ​agreed ​on Monday to ‌expand ‍cooperation ‍in sectors such ‌as artificial intelligence, aerospace, chips ‍and critical ‍minerals, according to ⁠the ⁠Blue House.

articles.title: Micron says ‘unprecedented’ memory shortage to last beyond 2026
articles.summary: High-bandwidth memory required to make artificial intelligence accelerators is “consuming so much of the available capacity across the industry that it’s leaving a tremendous shortage for the conventional side of the industry, for phones or PCs,” Bhatia said. He added that PC and smartphone makers have joined the queue to try to lock up memory chips after 2026.

articles.title: South Korea to negotiate with the US for favourable chip tariff terms, official says
articles.summary: The country ‌last year released a joint fact sheet on its trade deal with the U.S. that ​included terms ensuring ​South Korea will not ‌receive unfavourable ‍treatment from U.S. ‍tariffs on imported chips compared to ‌key competitors, the official said, when asked about the Trump administration's proclamation imposing tariffs on artificial intelligence chips.

articles.title: Micron's $1.8 billion acquisition boosts Powerchip shares
articles.summary: Micron Technology on Saturday ‌said it had signed a letter of intent to ‍acquire Powerchip's P5 ‍fabrication site ⁠in ⁠Tongluo, Miaoli County, Taiwan, for $1.8 billion in cash.

articles.title: Nano GCC attrition shaped by clearly defined roadmaps
articles.summary: India’s nano GCCs are diverging, with long-term centres showing 80-88% employee retention, while short-term or contract-led setups face high churn. Smaller teams of 20-150 employees are highly sensitive to attrition, affecting product delivery and IP development. Rising demand for AI and specialised tech skills is driving targeted hiring and higher salaries.

articles.title: Groww steps up wealth play via MF and portfolio management solutions
articles.summary: Groww is expanding deeper into wealth management by developing platforms for high-net-worth clients and mutual fund distributors. This follows its acquisition of Fisdom, which has been integrated into Groww’s operations. The Bengaluru-based firm aims to scale digital tools to help distributors service clients and compete with startups like AssetPlus and ZFunds.

articles.title: Bill to allow Uber, Lyft in Israel gains committee approval
articles.summary: Israel’s ministerial committee has approved a law to allow ride-hailing services like Uber and Lyft, aiming to reduce taxi fares. The reform, still needing full parliamentary approval, sets safety rules, driver checks, and insurance while supporting existing taxi operators. Transport Minister Miri Regev said it would boost jobs, competition, and ease congestion.

articles.title: Micron to buy Taiwan chip fabrication site for $1.8 billion
articles.summary: Micron Technology plans to buy a Taiwanese fabrication site from Powerchip Semiconductor Manufacturing for $1.8 billion to boost chip production. The Tongluo site will gradually increase DRAM production, with major volumes expected by 2027, alongside a partnership on assembly processing. The move supports Micron’s global expansion, including investment in new US plants.

articles.title: Social media addiction's surprising challenger? Anti-doomscrolling influencers
articles.summary: Social media users often lose track of time scrolling. Content creators like Olivia Unplugged and Cat Goetze are appearing on platforms to gently remind people about their screen time. They explain the psychology behind social media's addictive nature. Experts agree people spend too much time on apps.

articles.title: In a cooling job market, AI pros still hold the cards
articles.summary: AI professionals are getting not just multiple offers but also counter-offers from existing employers and big incentives. New job offers and counteroffers currently come with 25-70% pay hikes for AI professionals, executives at search firms and recruitment services firms said. This trend is only going to get stronger in 2026, they told ET.

articles.title: Netweb Technologies Q3 profit more than doubles to Rs 73 crore
articles.summary: In an impressive display of growth, Netweb Technologies reported record-breaking quarterly profit and revenue from October to December. The company’s profit after tax soared to Rs 73.31 crore, marking a notable increase year-on-year. Revenue followed suit with a remarkable climb to Rs 811.56 crore.

articles.title: Google files to appeal decision in search monopoly case
articles.summary: Google filed a notice on Friday to appeal a federal judge's ruling that it held an illegal monopoly on online search, court records show. That order risks Google losing trade secrets before a decision is made on its appeal, the company argued in a court filing.

articles.title: Musk jokes about buying Ryanair as Starlink feud with CEO Michael O’Leary escalates
articles.summary: This followed Ryanair’s official account trolling Musk during a widespread outage on X on two consecutive days. The clash began when O’Leary, an interview on the radio show Newstalk, dismissed Starlink as impractical for Ryanair, which is evaluating in-flight connectivity options for its fleet.

articles.title: US FTC to scrutinise Big Tech's talent acquisition deals: Report
articles.summary: The US Federal Trade Commission is scrutinising ‍big tech firms that ​hire employees of a startup instead of ⁠buying the companies outright. The growing practice, in which big ‌tech firms ‌pay for startups' technology and talent without buying the company, is seen ‌as a way to sidestep antitrust review.

articles.title: Why students are choosing quick commerce gigs over internships
articles.summary: The discussion was sparked by an X post by author and market analyst Swapnil Kommawar, who shared how a friend’s brother, while pursuing a degree course, chose to work part-time as a gig worker with quick commerce platform Zepto instead of taking up an internship. The person took up the job thanks to the scarcity of paid internships and the urgent need for money to meet personal expenses, given the family’s financial constraints.

articles.title: Tesla granted more time in US investigation into its self-driving tech
articles.summary: An investigation of Tesla's full-self driving feature was opened in October after the National Highway and Traffic Safety Administration said it had collected dozens of reports of the cars running red lights or driving on the wrong side of the road, sometimes crashing into other vehicles and causing injuries.

articles.title: Shadowfax set to go public amid changing logistics landscape
articles.summary: The third-party logistics (3PL) player is eyeing a valuation of Rs 7,169 crore, down from its earlier target of Rs 8,500-9,000 crore. The issue will be closely watched as the first major 3PL listing after Delhivery’s Ecom Express buy. The company follows a tech-driven and asset-light model and relies on a crowdsourced network of delivery partners compared to competitor Delhivery’s model of its own fleet of last-mile vehicles. Shadowfax, which has seen its market share rise from about 8% in FY22

articles.title: Why Elon Musk is seeking up to $134 billion from OpenAI, Microsoft in 'wrongful gains'
articles.summary: OpenAI gained between $65.5 billion and $109.4 billion from the billionaire entrepreneur's contributions when he was co-founding OpenAI from 2015, while ‌Microsoft gained ‌between $13.3 billion and $25.1 billion, Musk said in the federal court filing ahead of his trial against ‌the two companies.

articles.title: 'Can't wait to start trial': Elon Musk slams OpenAI ahead of court case; Sam Altman responds
articles.summary: Ahead of a jury trial that is set to begin in May, both sides are releasing certain documents and call notes, accusing each other of bad faith over OpenAI’s shift from a nonprofit to a for-profit model.

articles.title: Nvidia H200 chip parts suppliers halt output after China blocks shipments: Report
articles.summary: Nvidia had expected more than 1 million orders from Chinese clients, the report said, adding that its suppliers had been operating around the clock ​to prepare for shipping as ​early as March.

articles.title: Reliance’s JioMart hits 1.6 million daily orders, claims to be second-largest qcomm player in India
articles.summary: JioMart now operates across more than 5,000 pin codes, supported by over 3,000 stores in over 1,000 cities. Without disclosing exact figures, Reliance claimed that transaction frequency on its digital platforms is roughly twice that of competitors.

articles.title: Quick commerce market heats up; Blinkit drops delivery fees in select markets
articles.summary: Blinkit has cut delivery fees in select micro-markets like Gurgaon, Bengaluru and Mumbai to stay competitive against Amazon Now and Flipkart Minutes. Other quick commerce players, including Zepto and Instamart, had already reduced charges. The move aims to retain customers as rapid expansion and dark store growth intensify market competition.

articles.title: Trump effect: Cotton fabrics exports drop 30%
articles.summary: Indian cotton textile exports saw a sharp fall after the US introduced tariffs in August 2025. Shipments dropped by nearly 30 percent following the levy. This decline impacted all categories, including fabrics, made-ups, and ready-made garments. Companies are exploring strategies like discounts to mitigate the impact. The situation is expected to remain volatile for some time.

articles.title: US-EU bitter trade row may boost India exports, sweeten Europe FTA
articles.summary: A potential US-EU trade dispute could boost Indian exports as the EU seeks stronger ties with nations like India. With the US imposing tariffs on several European goods, the EU may expedite its free trade agreement talks with India. This could lead to a more favorable deal and faster ratification, presenting India as a stable trade partner amidst global uncertainties.

articles.title: India, EU set to conclude FTA talks on January 27; deal after legal clearances
articles.summary: India and the European Union will announce the conclusion of free trade agreement negotiations at a summit on January 27. A security and defence partnership agreement will also be signed. EU leadership will attend India's Republic Day celebrations as chief guests. Negotiations for the trade pact resumed in 2022 and are in the final stages.

articles.title: India ranks 16 among 154 countries on Responsible Nations Index
articles.summary: India secured 16th place out of 154 countries in the new Responsible Nations Index, a framework assessing national conduct towards citizens, the environment, and the world. The index, launched by the World Intellectual Foundation, highlights that economic strength doesn't guarantee responsible behavior, with developing nations often outperforming wealthier ones in key areas.

articles.title: China urges WTO to set up panel in case against India's incentive schemes for auto, battery, EV
articles.summary: China has requested the WTO's dispute settlement body to establish a panel to examine its case against India's incentive schemes for auto, battery, and electric vehicles. Bilateral consultations failed to resolve the dispute, with China alleging the schemes violate global trade rules by discriminating against its goods.

articles.title: RBI Guv Malhotra calls for high standards of governance in urban co-op banks
articles.summary: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra met with top officials of select Urban Cooperative Banks, stressing the importance of strong governance and asset quality oversight. He acknowledged UCBs' role in credit delivery and financial inclusion, expressing confidence that recent policy initiatives will foster sector growth and health.

articles.title: India-EU Summit: Trade, defence and mobility deals on table
articles.summary: European Council President Antonio Costa and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will be the chief guests at the Republic Day celebrations on January 26, and the India-EU summit will be held the next day.

articles.title: India-UAE aim to double trade to $200 billion by 2032; ink deals on LNG, defence, and space
articles.summary: India and the UAE have set an ambitious target to double bilateral trade to $200 billion by 2032, signing key agreements in energy, defense, and space. A 10-year LNG supply deal between HPCL and ADNOC was confirmed, bolstering India's energy security. The nations also advanced defense and space cooperation, signaling a decade of closer economic and strategic integration.

articles.title: Provide incentive in Budget for R&D, create specialised fin institution for long-term fund: MPC member Nagesh Kumar
articles.summary: RBI MPC member Nagesh Kumar urged the government to offer policy incentives for R D and establish an institutional fund for long-term manufacturing capital in the upcoming Budget. He also suggested restoring the 200% weighted tax deduction for R D expenditure and creating a specialized development financing institution for manufacturing to boost growth and competitiveness.

articles.title: Government should consider simplifying, rationalising tax laws in Budget to boost FDI: Experts
articles.summary: They also suggested that efforts should be made to reduce the cost of capital. The budget needs to signal a credible medium-term path of fiscal consolidation and debt reduction, they added.

articles.title: India's December oilmeal exports fall 40% on weak soyabean meal shipments
articles.summary: In December, India's oilmeal exports plummeted by 40 percent, largely attributed to a drastic decline in soyabean meal shipments. Other oilmeals, such as rapeseed and castorseed meals, also saw diminished export levels. Conversely, the exports of rice bran extraction experienced a remarkable upswing. Over the April-December timeframe, total oilmeal exports faced a 6 percent drop.

articles.title: Goodbye VCRs, hello OTT: India’s inflation basket prepares for a reset
articles.summary: India's inflation gauge is undergoing a significant overhaul, phasing out outdated items like VCRs and introducing modern essentials such as smartphones and streaming services. While free food from the public distribution system will be excluded to align with global norms and prevent inflation distortion, this decision sparks debate among economists about a complete inflation picture.

articles.title: IMF raises India's FY26 growth forecast to 7.3%
articles.summary: India's economic growth is projected to be robust. The International Monetary Fund has increased its forecast for India's FY26 growth to 7.3 percent. This makes India the fastest-growing economy among major nations. The World Bank also revised its outlook upwards. Global growth is expected to be steady. Inflation in India is anticipated to return to target levels.

articles.title: RBI likely to keep interest rates steady as inflation edges up, Crisil says
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is anticipated to hold its key policy rates steady. This decision comes as inflation shows a moderate increase. Despite this, the economic outlook remains positive with strong growth projections. Experts foresee a stable monetary policy environment for the upcoming period. This approach balances economic expansion with price stability.

articles.title: Greenland shock: Europe's pain proves India read Donald Trump right
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump's trade threats have created a crisis for European Union trade deals. EU lawmakers are now preparing to retaliate against the US. This situation highlights the wisdom of India's careful trade negotiations. India avoided rushing into agreements, prioritising its national interests. This approach has preserved India's strategic options and negotiating strength.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India Inc seeks GST-style simplification in customs duty structure
articles.summary: As Budget 2026 discussions ramp up, Indian businesses are gearing up for transformative shifts in customs duties. They are advocating for a seamless framework akin to GST, aiming to enhance trade efficiency and expedite dispute resolution. Their requests include a consolidated clearance window, expedited timelines for Authorized Economic Operator (AEO) certification, and a more efficient customs investigation protocol.

articles.title: IMF raises India’s 2025 growth target to 7.3% while the world shakes off tariff disruptions
articles.summary: IMF India growth outlook has been revised upward for 2025 by 0.7 pp to 7.3 percent. This is due to better corporate earnings and strong economic momentum. IMF said global economy is also showing resilience. AI investment is a key driver. Global growth is projected to hold steady. Inflation is expected to decline. However, the risks include AI sector valuations and geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: Govt permits exports of 5 lakh tonnes of wheat flour
articles.summary: The government has allowed limited exports of wheat flour and related products, permitting shipments of up to 5 lakh tonnes, marking a partial easing of the ban imposed in 2022. The Directorate General of Foreign Trade said exports will remain prohibited beyond this quota and will require prior authorisation.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP growth of 7.3% to boost average household income, insurance demand: Moody’s
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow by 7.3 per cent in FY 2025. This robust expansion will boost household incomes and drive demand for insurance. The insurance sector anticipates sustained premium growth due to economic strength, digitisation, and planned reforms. Increased risk awareness and easier product access are also contributing factors.

articles.title: India set to move into upper-middle-income group by 2030 & join China: SBI
articles.summary: India is likely to enter the upper-middle-income group by the end of this decade, joining China and Indonesia, according to a report by the State Bank of India (SBI). SBI said India is expected to reach a per capita income of $4,000 by 2030, meeting the current threshold for the category.

articles.title: A trade deal India pursued for 18 years is now within reach but risks remain
articles.summary: India is on the cusp of sealing a transformative free trade agreement with the European Union, marking the largest of its kind for the country. This landmark deal encompasses a wide range of goods and services, paving the way for enhanced economic collaboration. Nevertheless, ongoing discussions are needed regarding climate taxes and the mobility of services.

articles.title: View: Why India has a private investment problem
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow at 7.4%, yet Prime Minister Modi faces a critical decision between continued infrastructure spending and fiscal restraint. Despite strong headline growth, low private investment and a ballooning debt-to-GDP ratio of 81% signal what may be an unsustainable model.

articles.title: National Highway builders ask Finmin to clarify arbitration order
articles.summary: The National Highway Builders Federation has urged the finance ministry to clarify its order ending arbitration for highway projects. The federation warns this change discourages investment and increases project costs. It suggests the new dispute resolution framework could make projects unbankable. This impacts ongoing projects and future infrastructure development. The federation is also flagging concerns with bankers and financial lenders.

articles.title: Commerce Ministry formulates specific guidelines for missions abroad to boost exports
articles.summary: New guidelines are in place for Indian missions abroad. The government aims to boost exports by diversifying markets. These steps are crucial amid global economic uncertainties. Commercial representatives will manage trade barriers and conduct market research. The goal is to leverage free trade agreements and increase their utilization. India targets USD 2 trillion in exports by 2030.

articles.title: India-US partnership is growing across trade, technology: US Ambassador to India, Sergio Gor
articles.summary: US Ambassador to India, Sergio Gor, on Sunday concluded his 'successful' visit to Mumbai, highlighting the growing partnership between India and the United States across trade, technology, education, energy and resilient supply chains.

articles.title: India to grow at a healthy 7% in 2026-27 despite global uncertainties: CareEdge
articles.summary: CareEdge Ratings expects the Indian economy to grow by 7 per cent in 2026-27 despite global uncertainties, supported by low inflation, softer interest rates and a lower tax burden. The rating agency said services exports would continue to support the external position even as merchandise exports face pressure from tariff-related uncertainties.

articles.title: Mother of all trade deals is loading: What it means for India
articles.summary: India and EU are on the cusp of a landmark Free Trade Agreement, potentially dubbed the 'mother of all deals.' This pact, two decades in the making, aims to boost bilateral trade and investment, offering a crucial diversification avenue amidst rising protectionism. Key sticking points include market access for automobiles and agriculture, but a breakthrough could reshape global trade.

articles.title: India's average return on FDI remains robust at 7.3%, outperforming emerging economies: CareEdge
articles.summary: India saw gross FDI inflows rise to USD 81 billion in FY25. However, increased profit repatriation and outflows significantly reduced net FDI to just USD 1 billion. Despite this, India's return on inward FDI remains strong. Emerging sectors like semiconductors and EVs are attracting foreign investment. Global FDI flows are lagging GDP growth.

articles.title: India–EU FTA likely to spur textiles, pharma, engineering sectors: exporters
articles.summary: A free trade agreement between India and the European Union is set to boost exports in textiles, pharmaceuticals, chemicals, and engineering goods. Exporters anticipate a doubling of shipments to the EU within three years. This pact offers a stable framework for Indian businesses, aiding long-term investments and market access. It also helps diversify export markets, reducing reliance on single regions.

articles.title: Indian Jute Mills Association seeks ban on private raw jute trading
articles.summary: The Indian Jute Mills Association has asked the government to stop private raw jute trading after March 31. This move aims to control rising prices and ensure fibre availability for mills. The association claims many mills have shut down, leaving thousands jobless. The proposal seeks to stabilize prices and secure jute bag supply for upcoming seasons.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EV incentives, step up R&D, localisation push on wishlist
articles.summary: India's upcoming Union Budget is expected to boost electric vehicle adoption. Measures will likely focus on strengthening domestic manufacturing and reducing reliance on imports. Incentives could be recalibrated to encourage investment across the EV value chain. This aims to support sustainable transport and conserve foreign exchange.

articles.title: Mother of all deals: Piyush Goyal on upcoming FTA with European Union
articles.summary: India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the proposed Free Trade Agreement with the European Union as the "mother of all deals," anticipating a mutually beneficial pact that will boost exports. He assured that national interests would not be compromised, with sensitive issues like the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism and dairy to be addressed satisfactorily.

articles.title: India works to protect Chabahar Port after waiver ends
articles.summary: India is gearing up to unveil an innovative strategy for Chabahar Port, paving the way for strengthening its stake following the anticipated end of US sanctions in April. Collaborating with a regional Iranian firm, India Ports Global Limited aims to regain operational control over this crucial port.

articles.title: Cross-border e-commerce gets a legup, postal exports put on par with cargo shipments
articles.summary: Government reforms now treat postal e-commerce exports like regular cargo, enabling speedier clearances and access to key export incentives. These changes, effective January 15, address a procedural bottleneck, benefiting small sellers and e-commerce firms by streamlining processes and improving cash flow for digital-first exporters.

articles.title: Microcredit scheme for gig, platform workers in works
articles.summary: A new microcredit scheme is being finalized to offer collateral-free loans up to Rs 10,000 annually to gig workers and domestic helps. This initiative aims to support entrepreneurial journeys for vulnerable sections. The scheme will be launched in the next fiscal year, starting April 2026.

articles.title: Gems, jewellery exports dip 4.98% in December to $1,883.85 million: GJEPC
articles.summary: India's gem and jewellery exports saw a dip in December 2025. Geopolitical issues impacted demand in key markets. However, overall exports remained stable. Jewellery exports, especially gold and silver, showed strong growth. This balanced out a slowdown in cut and polished diamonds. Free Trade Agreements are boosting exports to countries like the UAE and Australia.

articles.title: Japan bond yields soar as election promises stir fiscal fears
articles.summary: Japanese government bond yields have reached record highs. This surge is driven by worries over potential tax cuts ahead of an election. These cuts could strain government finances. A weak auction for 20-year debt has intensified the sell-off. Market participants are cautious, with no clear buyers at current levels. Political uncertainty and fiscal outlook are key concerns.

articles.title: Budget 2026: How India introduced, scrapped and raised capital gains taxes for stock market investors
articles.summary: As Budget 2026 approaches, the stock market is demanding tax relief amid persistent foreign investor selling and weak returns. India's equity taxation has evolved significantly, with long-term capital gains tax reintroduced in 2018 and short-term gains recently increased. Market participants hope for policy adjustments to revive inflows and confidence.

articles.title: HDFC Bank’s forced balancing act drags stock 6%, makes it Nifty Bank’s biggest laggard. What to do?
articles.summary: HDFC Bank shares remain under pressure despite in-line Q3 results as deposit concerns and a stretched CD ratio weigh on sentiment. Brokerages stay constructive, citing medium-term growth visibility, valuation comfort, and gradual normalisation of balance sheet metrics.

articles.title: India bonds rise on bargain buying, state debt sale eyed
articles.summary: Indian government bonds saw a firming trend Tuesday, driven by bargain buying as the 10-year yield held below a crucial level. Reduced state debt supply for the week also bolstered sentiment. Traders anticipate limited market movement until the federal budget announcement on February 1, with focus shifting to a significant state debt sale later today.

articles.title: Trump tariff threat casts shadow over Germany’s fragile recovery
articles.summary: Industry groups in Germany have responded with alarm, warning that such measures would strain transatlantic relations and damage both sides. Business associations criticised the escalation as harmful and unnecessary, stressing that political disputes should not spill over into trade. Exporters and wholesalers also voiced strong support for Denmark, underscoring that democratic principles should not be undermined by economic pressure.

articles.title: Budget 2026: The arithmetic that will decide India’s bond market
articles.summary: Budget 2026 will be crucial for India’s bond market, with investors seeking fiscal continuity, credible deficit targets and transparent consolidation. Borrowing strategy, capex execution, and small savings flows will shape yields, while improved market microstructure gains importance amid deferred global index inclusion, making trust between fiscal policy and markets essential.

articles.title: Shadowfax IPO at 1,000x P/E: What are investors hopes for listing gains?
articles.summary: Shadowfax Technologies' IPO opens with a high valuation, trading at over 1,000 times its latest earnings. Despite a premium valuation compared to peers like Blue Dart Express and Delhivery, analysts point to strong revenue growth and an asset-light model as potential drivers.

articles.title: Markets watch closely as US top court takes up Fed independence test
articles.summary: The US Supreme Court is set to hear a landmark case that could test the Federal Reserve’s independence, as it examines whether a president can remove a Fed governor. The case, stemming from Donald Trump’s attempt to oust Governor Lisa Cook, could either reinforce the central bank’s insulation from political pressure or clarify how presidents might lawfully exert control, potentially redefining the limits of presidential authority over monetary policy.

articles.title: Tariff threats revive ‘Sell America’ fears as Trump rekindles trade war jitters
articles.summary: Tariff threats from President Trump have revived “Sell America” fears as markets brace for renewed trade war tensions. European equities fell, the dollar weakened, and safe-haven currencies gained, while investors assess the risk of escalated U.S.–EU retaliation and potential shifts in European exposure to U.S. assets, Reuters reported.

articles.title: UPL subsidiary Advanta Enterprises files draft IPO papers with Sebi
articles.summary: UPL’s seed business Advanta Enterprises has filed draft IPO papers with Sebi for a proposed offer for sale, allowing the agrochemicals group and other shareholders to partially monetise their holdings amid an active Indian primary market.

articles.title: More pain ahead? Top 10 retail-dominated stocks crash up to 43% as Indian markets underperformed since one year
articles.summary: Retail-dominated Indian stocks have experienced significant declines, with top performers crashing up to 43% since June 2024. This sharp correction, particularly in stocks with high retail ownership, highlights the vulnerability of crowded trades when market momentum shifts. Several prominent companies across sectors like infrastructure, green energy, and IT have seen substantial losses.

articles.title: From housing affordability to green buildings: what real estate expects from Budget 2026
articles.summary: As Budget 2026 nears, India's real estate sector seeks policy continuity, fiscal support, and structural reforms to sustain growth. Industry leaders emphasize affordability, infrastructure, capital access, and regulatory efficiency to boost confidence across residential, commercial, and mixed-use segments, positioning real estate as a key driver of urban transformation and economic progress.

articles.title: Brokerages initiate coverage on Meesho, Groww, Angel One, 8 other stocks this week. How many do you have?
articles.summary: Brokerages have started covering eleven Indian stocks this week. Analysts are positive on companies like Groww, Angel One, and Meesho. They predict potential gains of up to 51% for some stocks. This coverage includes companies in broking, insurance, and hospitality sectors. Investors can find new opportunities with these initiated reports.

articles.title: Markets muted, select opportunities emerge amid volatility: Sunny Agrawal
articles.summary: Indian stock markets are experiencing weakness. Experts advise investors to focus on companies with strong earnings growth. The auto and auto ancillary sectors show promise. Mid-sized banks are also performing well. Investors can find opportunities in quality stocks for medium-term gains. Long-term investors can look at sectors like steel.

articles.title: Aditya Birla Fashion shares slide 9% after reports of Rs 289 crore block deal
articles.summary: Shares of Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail slid to a 52-week low after a Rs 289 crore block deal, as reports pointed to a clean-out trade by an undisclosed institutional investor.

articles.title: Rupee falls 8 paise to 90.98 against US dollar in early trade
articles.summary: The rupee weakened by 8 paise to 90.98 against the US dollar in early trade Tuesday, driven by strong dollar demand from metal importers and consistent foreign fund outflows. Geopolitical uncertainty and a sluggish domestic stock market, fueled by foreign capital exodus, further pressured the Indian currency.

articles.title: India’s earnings recovery priced in; Venugopal Garre explains why markets now need upgrades, not optimism
articles.summary: Indian equities may see moderate gains, but sharp upside looks limited as earnings recovery is already priced in, says Bernstein’s Venugopal Garre. With margins near peak levels, weak nominal growth and limited fiscal headroom, markets now need clear earnings upgrade triggers, not just recovery hopes, to drive stronger returns in 2026 and beyond.

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra AMC, Aequitas among top 10 equity PMS performers in 2025. Full list here
articles.summary: In December 2025, Indian equities saw volatile trading with investors favoring selective strategies. East Green Advisors' Quant Strategy led the top 10 equity PMS performers with an 8.33% return. Kotak Mahindra AMC's Fintech and Aequitas' India Opportunities Product also featured prominently among the top performers.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling
articles.summary: Indian stock markets continued their downward trend on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty experiencing a second consecutive session of declines. Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

articles.title: Gold prices near Rs 1.50 lakh, silver up Rs 7,900 as Greenland concerns drive rally. Too late to buy?
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices surged to record highs on Tuesday, driven by renewed trade war concerns following US President Donald Trump's tariff threats linked to Greenland. Investors sought safe-haven assets amid heightened global uncertainty. While prices later pared some gains, volatility is expected to persist.

articles.title: Wipro among 7 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
articles.summary: A sharp increase in futures open interest indicates a rise in the number of active, unexpired contracts in a security.

articles.title: Selling spree! Dolly Khanna trims stake in 5 stocks, exits one in Q3. Do you own any?
articles.summary: Ace investor Dolly Khanna has adopted a cautious approach in Q3 FY26, trimming stakes in five stocks and potentially exiting one. She has also added IFB Agro Industries to her portfolio. This move comes amid a generally cautious market sentiment.

articles.title: Rs 8,600 crore selloff! Infosys most sold stock by mutual funds in December. Time for a U-turn?
articles.summary: Mutual funds divested Rs 8,600 crore of Infosys shares in December. The IT major has since reported better-than-expected Q3 results and increased its full-year growth forecast. This performance is now attracting investor attention, signaling a potential stabilization in the stock's outlook. Analysts are revising targets upwards, anticipating accelerated growth driven by AI services.

articles.title: PB Fintech among 4 stocks flashing bullish signals, hinting at a possible uptrend
Adani Power in focus as NCLAT clears Rs 4,000-crore Vidarbha Power acquisition
articles.summary: In terms of valuation, the stock is currently trading at a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 22.86. Its price-to-sales (P/S) ratio stands at 3.49, while the price-to-book (P/B) ratio is 4.73, indicating how the market values the company relative to its earnings, revenue, and net worth.

articles.title: BCCL to fund expansion through internal accruals despite OFS IPO; targets 3x realisation from coal washing
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal says it will fund expansion and modernisation through internal cash flows despite its IPO being a pure OFS. The Coal India subsidiary targets over ₹2,000 crore annual profit, plans to double coal washing capacity, and expects up to 3x realisation from washed coal, with growth driven by rising steel demand.

articles.title: ACME Solar shares in focus as 68 MW Gujarat wind project goes operational
articles.summary: ACME Solar Holdings announced the commencement of commercial operations for 68 MW of its 100 MW wind power project in Gujarat. Implemented via its subsidiary, the project is backed by a long-term PPA with GUVNL, supporting stable revenues and strengthening ACME’s wind energy portfolio.

articles.title: The Golden Thumb Rule | Why missing the first 10% doesn’t matter in long-term investing: Deepak Shenoy
articles.summary: Deepak Shenoy of Capitalmind Mutual Fund advises long-term investors to avoid market timing, emphasizing that missing the first 10% of a move is a worthwhile trade-off for discipline. He stresses focusing on earnings growth and long-term trends over short-term noise and geopolitical events to navigate uncertain markets effectively.

articles.title: IHCL betting on boutique luxury and wellness as asset-light strategy drives margins and growth: Puneet Chhatwal
articles.summary: IHCL CEO Puneet Chhatwal explains the strategic rationale behind the Brij Hotels acquisition, the shift to an asset-light model, expansion into boutique luxury and wellness, margin outlook, capex plans of up to ₹10,000 crore, and how Indian Hotels aims to drive sustainable growth, higher ROCE and strong cash flows over the next five years.

articles.title: Fractional ownership and REITs are democratising commercial real estate: S.K. Sayal, Bharti Real Estate
articles.summary: India's commercial real estate is evolving with fractional ownership and REITs democratizing access to institutional-grade assets. Developers are focusing on integrated global business districts with strong infrastructure and walk-to-work ecosystems. The Delhi-NCR office leasing market remains robust, driven by demand for high-quality spaces from diverse sectors.

articles.title: ETMarkets Smart Talk | Caution on gold, optimism on PSU banks and defence: Gaurav Bhandari’s 2026 market playbook
articles.summary: As markets brace for 2026, Monarch Networth Capital CEO Gaurav Bhandari advises caution on speculative gold and silver rallies. He remains constructive on Indian equities, particularly PSU banks and defence, citing strong fundamentals and government support.

articles.title: Havells India among 4 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
Avana Electrosystems shares to list today. Check GMP ahead of debut
articles.summary: Based on the prevailing GMP, the stock is indicated to list at around Rs 69-70 per share, though grey market trends are unofficial and can change closer to listing.

articles.title: Shadowfax IPO Day 1 Live Updates: GMP at 5%; issue subscribed 11% so far. Check brokerage reviews and other details
Tata Motors PV Share Price Live Updates: Tata Motors PV Sees Price Drop
Bajaj Auto Share Price Live Updates: Bajaj Auto's Daily Performance Update
Shadowfax IPO opens for bidding. Check GMP, brokerages review, subscription and other details
articles.summary: Shadowfax Technologies' Rs 1,907-crore IPO opens Tuesday, aiming to tap into India's e-commerce growth. The logistics firm, valued at Rs 7,169 crore pre-IPO, offers a fresh issue and an offer for sale. Despite strong revenue growth, brokerages express caution due to rich valuations and thin profitability.

articles.title: SBI Life Share Price Live Updates: SBI Life's Price Analysis
Bajaj Finserv Share Price Live Updates: Bajaj Finserv's Current Trading Status
Adani Ent Share Price Live Updates: Adani Enterprises  Current Price Update
UltraTech Cem Share Price Live Updates: UltraTech Cement's Market Update
Jio Financial Services Share Price Live Updates: Jio Financial Services' stock price declines
Tech cos wooing graduates with AI, cloud, other specialised skills at higher pay packages: Report
articles.summary: According to a report in The Times of India, tech companies are offering pay cheques from Rs 16 lakh to Rs 55 lakh to freshers for niche roles, about four times higher than the Rs 4-lakh package usually seen for fresher hiring. Entry-level hiring has slowed overall, but companies are increasingly giving priority to recruiting fewer specialised roles rather than volume hiring.

articles.title: Inside China's buzzing AI scene year after DeepSeek shock
articles.summary: Before DeepSeek shook up the tech world and put Chinese artificial intelligence on the map, Wu Chenglin's own startup had nearly folded three times -- but in the past year it has raised $30 million. But as excitement around DeepSeek fuelled a boom in spending, Wu raised 220 million yuan in two funding rounds.

articles.title: Britain needs 'AI stress tests' for financial services, lawmakers say
articles.summary: In a report on AI in financial services, the Treasury Committee said the Financial Conduct Authority and the Bank of England should start running AI‑specific stress tests to help firms ‌prepare for ‌market shocks triggered by automated systems.

articles.title: Republic Day to lift ecommerce sales; Shadowfax nets anchor funds
articles.summary: Happy Tuesday! Ecommerce sales are set to rise during this year’s Republic Day sale season. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: LTIMindtree suffers 12% fall in Q3 net profit, at Rs 959 crore
articles.summary: LTI Mindtree reported an 11.7% drop in net profit for September–December, impacted by one-off labour code implementation expenses. Revenue grew 11.6% year-on-year in December, supported by strong deals and AI demand. The company aims to double revenue in five years, focusing on growth and market positioning.

articles.title: Rise in contract value for top IT firms signals stronger deal pipeline
articles.summary: India’s top IT firms showed mixed Q3 results, with Infosys, HCLTech and Tech Mahindra posting strong deal growth, signalling improving demand. TCS and Wipro saw declines, though management noted early signs of AI-led service recovery. Analysts caution that execution, pricing pressure, and evolving AI adoption may limit short-term growth despite healthy bookings.

articles.title: AI to reshape India’s $280-billion IT industry, but skill gaps could trigger job losses: Coursera cofounder Andrew Ng
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is redrawing the skills map for India’s $280 billion IT services industry, and unless professionals upskill at speed, job disruption could be severe, said AI pioneer Andrew Ng, founder of DeepLearning.AI and cofounder of Coursera. He also cautioned against the swelling hype over AGI, arguing that large language models are not a path to human-level intelligence and that claims of AGI being imminent are misleading.

articles.title: Nandan Nilekani’s Fundamentum leads $15 million bet on materials science startup Whizzo
articles.summary: Whizzo has raised $15 million in a round led by Nandan Nilekani’s Fundamentum, with participation from South Korea-based deeptech player LB Investment, and existing backers Lightspeed Venture Partners and BEENEXT.

articles.title: Warehouse automation startup Unbox Robotics raises $28 million led by ICICI Venture
articles.summary: Unbox Robotics has raised $28 million in a round led by ICICI Venture, with participation from RedStart Labs, a subsidiary of InfoEdge, F-Prime, 3one4 Capital, Navam Capital, Force Ventures and existing investors, ET has learnt. The round, which includes a mix of primary and secondary capital, will be used to grow its engineering team, accelerate product development and expand market presence across India and other countries.

articles.title: IIFL Fintech closes Rs 500-crore second fund
articles.summary: IIFL Fintech Fund, backed by the financial services conglomerate IIFL Group, has announced the final close of its second fund after raising Rs 500 crore from domestic family offices and high net-worth individuals (HNIs). Also called the series II fund, this targets early-to-growth-stage fintech startups, with a focus on companies using generative artificial intelligence to build financial services products.

articles.title: Private equity finds beauty in Purplle Cosmetics' minority stake: Deal could value platform at $1.5 billion
articles.summary: Leading private equity firms are in discussions to invest in Purplle Cosmetics. The beauty platform is expected to be valued at around ₹13,000 crore. This potential deal involves both primary and secondary capital. Early investors may reduce their holdings. Purplle is a major player in India's growing beauty e-commerce market.

articles.title: Gujarat's AI-driven initiative to tackle stray cattle problem in Ahmedabad
articles.summary: In a major push towards smart governance, the Gujarat government is leveraging modern technology and Artificial Intelligence (AI) to develop cities as advanced urban centres, with a pilot project launched to tackle the issue of stray cattle in Ahmedabad.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh to be developed as AI creative tech hub, says CM Chandrababu Naidu
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh is set to become a hub for AI-driven creative enterprises. Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu met industry leaders in Zurich to discuss investment opportunities. The state is encouraging growth in digital media, gaming, and animation. Eros Innovations is exploring AI initiatives and virtual reality tourism promotion.

articles.title: Google crawls 3X more of the web than OpenAI, & how that matters
articles.summary: Google's extensive web crawling capabilities, significantly exceeding competitors like OpenAI, Microsoft, Anthropic, and Meta, could grant it a decisive advantage in the AI race. Cloudflare CEO Matthew Prince warns this dominance, fueled by Google's search crawler integration with AI data collection, presents a challenge for rivals seeking a level playing field.

articles.title: Digital India Foundation builds platform for failed startups
articles.summary: The Digital India Foundation, a Noida-based nonprofit, on Monday launched Phoenix Hub, a platform designed to help redistribute technology, innovations, and skilled workers from failed startups to new ventures.

articles.title: Chandrababu Naidu meets Eros Innovations team in Zurich to discuss AI initiatives for Andhra Pradesh
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister and TDP President N Chandrababu Naidu on Monday met Eros Innovations Chairman and Founder Kishore Lulla, along with co-presidents Ridhima Lulla and Swaneet Singh, in Zurich to discuss AI-driven initiatives for the state.

articles.title: Wipro shares sink, but IT hiring shows signs of life
articles.summary: Wipro shares have slid sharply on weak Q3 results and a subdued Q4 outlook. This and more in today’s ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Andreessen Horowitz makes a $3 billion bet against the AI bubble
articles.summary: The venture capital firm, which goes by the nickname a16z, set up a dedicated $1.25 billion war chest in 2024 for bets on AI infrastructure, a term that the fund defines more broadly than the costly chips and data centers that make AI run. This month, the firm said it would commit another $1.7 billion to the effort.

articles.title: 95% of AI pilots fail to deliver meaningful efficiency, says TCS CEO K Krithivasan
articles.summary: To move beyond the promise of AI and turn potential into performance, leaders must rethink not only what decisions are made, but how decision-making itself is designed, and how humans and AI can collaborate most effectively. K Krithivasan said that to unlock AI's true value, businesses need to collaborate across ecosystems, apply deep domain insights, ensure rigorous governance and scale responsibly through co-innovation models.

articles.title: LTIMindtree Q3 results: PAT falls 11% YoY to Rs 971 crore impacted by new labour code, revenue up 12%
articles.summary: LTIMindtree reported an eleven percent YoY decline in Q3 net profit due to one-time labour code costs. Excluding this impact, profit and revenue grew strongly, supported by AI-led deals, margin expansion, steady dollar growth and a rising base of large clients.

articles.title: Blue Machines AI sets new benchmark by engaging in unscripted hour-long debate on national TV
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking national television debut, Indian AI platform Blue Machines AI successfully engaged in a 60-minute unscripted news debate. This historic man-versus-machine contest showcased the AI's ability to handle complex discussions, interruptions, and rapid topic shifts, demonstrating enterprise-grade reliability and governance for India's burgeoning tech sector.

articles.title: Union agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan addresses media on VB-G Ram G Act | LIVE
Blackstone finalises structured investment deal in AI cloud startup Neysa
articles.summary: US firm Blackstone has finalised a structured investment in Mumbai-based AI cloud startup Neysa, initially putting in $50–75 million. The deal allows Blackstone to increase its stake to a controlling position if certain business milestones are met. Neysa was was last valued at $120-130 million, and has raised $50 million in funding across two rounds till now.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the Mightiest - How understanding fiscal policy & government spending will help you make money in the stock market
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. By now we have a fair idea how the RBI, with its control over interest rates and money supply, acts as a crucial hand on the economic tiller. There is, however, another hand at work, one that operates more directly: Fiscal policy. And this is the domain of the government. And it is expressed through the Union Budget, slated for February 1. Understanding the budget is thus crucial. In this series, Macro the

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas so far amid Trump crackdown; deportations to continue
articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: 'Mogambo Khush Hua': Kharge likens Trump to iconic villain, questions Modi’s silence
The unnatural beauty of Dhurandhar: Why Aditya Dhar's polarising film works as pure cinema

A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts

Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Ties with India witness a downturn as Bangladesh navigates turbulent 2025
articles.summary: Bangladesh faced a turbulent 2025 marked by political upheaval and economic hardship. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster led to strained relations with India. The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: IEX shares slide over 4% after CERC rolls out VPPA framework

articles.title: India, EU set to conclude Free Trade Deal by Jan 27

articles.title: IRFC eyes higher margins as it expands beyond Indian Railways

He added that fresh deals in the March quarter could take total sanctions closer to ₹80,000 crore, while disbursements are on track to cross the ₹30,000 crore mark for the year.

articles.summary: Chinese exports to the US suffered after President Donald Trump returned to office early last year and began raising tariffs. But that decline was offset by shipments to the rest of the world. Soaring imports of Chinese goods are prompting other governments to take action to protect local industries, in some cases by raising import duties.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Geoeconomic tensions top business risk for 2026, says WEF's Saadia Zahidi

Business leaders are worried about tariffs, investment controls, access to critical resources, and supply chains. articles.title: India needs inflation again: Why nominal GDP, not real growth, is the real Budget 2026 challenge

With inflation at multi-decade lows and nominal GDP losing momentum, policymakers face a new challenge: reviving revenues, earnings and debt dynamics in a world where disinflation may be structural rather than cyclical.

articles.summary: The disparity between China's robust manufacturing sector and persistently low domestic consumption is further highlighted by the growing surplus. The second-largest economy in the world has been driven by exports, but its long-term real estate recession and declining investment are limiting the nation's need for imported goods.

articles.title: India’s wholesale inflation rises to 0.83% in December
articles.summary: The Wholesale Price Index, or WPI, measures the change in prices of goods that wholesale businesses sell to and trade in bulk with other companies. Unlike the CPI, which tracks prices of goods and services purchased by consumers, WPI tracks factory gate prices before retail prices.
