articles.summary: Network18 led India’s digital news in 2025 with 2.5 billion CTV views, 56 billion total views, and 386 million social followers, setting the stage for CTV-first innovation in 2026.

articles.title: Prestige Group sees steady demand, eyes REIT once office portfolio scales up
articles.summary: Irfan Razack, CMD, Prestige Group, said the company plans to explore a REIT only after achieving adequate scale. The goal is to have around 45 million sq ft of completed and fully leased office assets, a milestone the group expects to reach by FY28–29.

articles.title: 11:11 | Davos 2026; Trump’s Greenland tariff gambit; Silver's rally; AI worsening global wealth gap & more
articles.summary: Today’s edition of 11:11 unpacks Trump’s Greenland tariff gambit ahead of Davos, WEF’s calls for quadrupling clean-fuel investment, and the $600-billion AI buildout reshaping capital. Also inside: a looming $200-billion global health gap, rising geoeconomic risks, silver’s ₹3-lakh milestone, AI widening inequality, Central Asia strategy, markets this week, and an ICICI Pru vs HDFC AMC comparison.

articles.title: Elon Musk eyes chip market, says will resume work on Dojo3 project
articles.summary: Last week, Musk stated that the AI5 chip's design was "almost done" and that the AI6 chip was still in its early phases. Musk stated last year that Samsung Electronics Co. would manufacture the upcoming AI6 processor for Tesla.

articles.title: Real estate developers look beyond metros: Trident Realty bets on tier-2 growth with ₹1,200-cr integrated township in Panipat
articles.summary: As metro affordability tightens, developers pivot to tier-2 cities like Panipat. Trident Realty’s ₹1,200 crore township signals the new growth frontier for Indian real estate.

articles.title: Revised wage rules hit IT, Banks hard as labour codes take effect
articles.summary: HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank saw significant employee cost hikes in December 2025 due to new labour codes, with IT giants like TCS and Infosys also reporting major expense increases.

articles.title: CG Power wins largest-ever, ₹900 crore order for data center project in the US
articles.summary: CG Power and Industrial Solutions Ltd won a ₹900 crore order from Tallgrass Integrated Logistics Solutions LLC, USA, for power transformers for a major data centre project, marking its global entry. Shares of CG Power and Industrial Solutions Ltd ended lower on Friday, January 16, by 2.82% ₹560.65 on the NSE.

articles.title: IndiGo staring at ₹1,180 cr-plus impact after DGCA’s final order on December disruptions
articles.summary: DGCA fined IndiGo ₹22.20 crore for December 2025 flight disruptions, with total financial exposure over ₹1,180 crore including compensation, refunds, and a ₹50 crore bank guarantee.

articles.title: SBI terminates GMU Kolkata lease; civil society urges RBI to step in
articles.summary: State Bank of India plans to close its Global Markets Unit in Kolkata, prompting Bank Bachao Desh Bachao Manch to urge RBI intervention to protect local banking and employment.

articles.title: GR Infraprojects emerges as L1 bidder for ₹488 crore BESS project at NTPC Mouda plant
articles.summary: G R Infraprojects has emerged as the lowest bidder for a ₹487.78 crore EPC project to implement a battery energy storage system at NTPC’s Mouda Super Thermal Power Station, with the contract slated for completion within 15 months.

articles.title: HDFC Bank Q3FY26 preview: Street eyes steady earnings amid LDR concerns
articles.summary: While headline earnings are expected to remain stable in the December quarter, investor attention will be firmly on HDFC Bank’s balance sheet dynamics, particularly the elevated loan-to-deposit ratio and management’s roadmap to restore funding comfort without compromising growth momentum.

articles.title: HG infra arm gets appointed date for ₹763 crore NH 227B highway project in Uttar Pradesh
articles.summary: HG Infra Engineering’s wholly owned subsidiary has received the appointed date of January 16, 2026 for a ₹763.11 crore NH 227B highway project in Uttar Pradesh, clearing the way for the start of construction under the hybrid annuity mode with a two-year execution period.

articles.title: ICICI Bank Q3 results preview: Street expects steady growth, margins to improve
articles.summary: ICICI Bank is expected to post steady December-quarter earnings, with analysts flagging healthy loan growth, a modest improvement in margins and higher seasonal slippages, while management commentary on growth outlook and leadership continuity remains in focus.

articles.title: Top Stories | Rupee slips, Reliance Industries results, BMC results, India-EU FTA talks and more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: India’s startup story won’t be derailed by Tiger Global tax verdict; returns matter more than structures, say VCs
articles.summary: Venture capital investors say the Supreme Court’s Tiger Global-Flipkart ruling reinforces the need for commercial substance over tax optimisation, but insist India’s startup funding and exit momentum will remain driven by strong growth prospects and market returns.

articles.title: From scale to selectivity: Is India’s startup ecosystem maturing?
articles.summary: On the 10th anniversary of Startup India, policymakers and industry leaders point to sectoral diversification, cautious capital and a gradual shift toward deeptech and sustainable growth

articles.title: Reliance Industries steps up new energy push; solar, battery giga factories on track

articles.title: Kohler growing at double the market rate in India, sees no signs of saturation
articles.summary: In an interaction with CNBC-TV18, Chris Ball, President, Kitchen and Bath, spoke about Kohler's openness to mergers and acquisitions in India, its strong balance sheet following the divestment of its energy business, and why being privately owned gives the company a structural edge.

articles.title: SC backs taxman in Flipkart deal: ₹967 crore Tiger Global withholding turns into final demand
articles.summary: The Supreme Court has upheld the tax department’s stand in the Flipkart-Walmart deal, turning ₹967 crore withheld from Tiger Global’s exit into a confirmed tax demand.

articles.title: Beyond Opulence: Purpose-driven luxury in modern India
articles.summary: Kotak Private Luxury Index 2025 reveals India’s wealthy now value wellness, experiential travel, and purposeful living over mere possessions, with luxury spending up 6.7 percent annually since 2022.

articles.title: RVNL bags ₹88 crore South Eastern Railway order for IP-based video surveillance
articles.summary: Rail Vikas Nigam (RVNL) won a ₹87.56 crore L1 order from South Eastern Railway to supply, install, and commission IP-based video surveillance systems in LHB coaches, to be executed over 10 months, with no related party involvement.

articles.title: Katrina Kaif’s Kay Beauty taps couture for global launch with Falguni Shane Peacock
articles.summary: Kay Beauty and Nykaa launch a couture-inspired makeup collection with Falguni Shane Peacock, blending luxury fashion and beauty, available in India, UK, and UAE with premium packaging and design.

articles.title: Jindal Saw Q3 profit slumps 49% YoY; margins contract sharply
articles.summary: Jindal Saw Ltd reported a 49% drop in net profit to ₹258 crore and a 6.2% fall in revenue for the December quarter. Shares of Jindal Saw Ltd ended lower on Friday, January 16, by 3.64% at ₹154.14 on the NSE.

articles.title: JSW Infrastructure Q3 Results: Net profit up 9% to ₹359 crore on higher cargo, Navkar volumes
articles.summary: JSW Infrastructure Q3 net profit rose 9.1% YoY to ₹359 crore on 14.2% revenue growth to ₹1,349 crore and a 10.1% rise in EBITDA to ₹643 crore, supported by 8% higher cargo volumes and strong Navkar performance; FY2026 targets ₹5,400 crore revenue and ₹2,600 crore EBITDA, with FY2027–28 EBITDA expected to grow sharply.

articles.title: Women lead India’s Big Tech push as Anthropic, Google, Meta and OpenAI expand in India
articles.summary: India’s Tech landscape is reshaped by women leaders, as Irina Ghose at Anthropic and Sandhya Devanathan at Meta drive AI and platforms while Google and YouTube expand across India’s digital economy.

articles.title: Shadowfax IPO: ₹1,907-crore issue opens today; brokerages neutral on valuations

articles.title: Oil prices steady as Greenland tensions and surplus worries in focus
articles.summary: West Texas Intermediate steadied near $59 a barrel, which was little changed from the previous close on Friday. The rates did not settle on Monday as it was a holiday in the US. Brent ended below $64.

articles.title: Japan's 40-year bond hits 4% for the first time as PM Takaichi calls for snap elections
articles.summary: The increase signifies a change in Japan's bond market, whose yields were significantly lower than those of its international counterparts due to years of extremely low interest rates. The yield on the country's 30-year bonds is higher than Germany's, which is currently at about 3.5%.

articles.title: Asian shares decline as Trump's Greenland tariff threats reignite trade tensions
articles.summary: Asian equities declined 0.5% while contracts for S P 500 were down 1.1%.

articles.title: Laxmi Dental shares, down 60% from their 52-week high, to see lock-in end today
articles.summary: After making a post-listing high at the start of last year, shares of Laxmi Dental have been on a downward spiral. The stock is down 60% from its post-listing high of ₹584 and has even corrected 45% from its IPO price of ₹428 apiece.

articles.title: Ola Electric CFO H Abichandani resigns; board OKs Deepak Rastogi as CFO

articles.title: Urban consumption has grown, but not for listed companies, says Kantar's Ramakrishnan
articles.summary: Kantar’s K Ramakrishnan said consumption sentiment improved in quarter three after government measures, but FMCG growth is rising slowly as GST price changes reach consumers. Quarterly volumes have increased, urban demand is shifting to smaller brands, and annualised FMCG growth is expected to cross 5% in the coming quarters.

articles.summary: Although shares of Hindustan Zinc are trading at 52-week high levels after the announcement, they are still below their record high, which is in excess of ₹800, and the stock also has very little free float in the market.

articles.summary: Indian bond prices slipped due to higher US Treasury yields, though lower state bond supply helped limit the pressure. Corporate bond issuance remained steady last week, with several companies raising funds through bonds and NCDs, and more issuances expected in the coming days.

articles.title: At 45, Nitin Nabin set to become BJP’s youngest president

articles.summary: Electronics industry urges government to fix inverted duties in upcoming Union Budget. It says current tariffs push firms to import machines, hurt local manufacturing, and deepen reliance on China.

If the recommendation is accepted, a proposal to link the digital currencies of BRICS members would be put forward for the first time. The BRICS organisation includes Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa, among others.

articles.summary: The deceased victim, Yuvraj Mehta, who did not know how to swim, managed to escape the car and climbed onto its roof. For nearly two hours, he fought to stay alive and repeatedly called his father and a close friend for help.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Tech Mahindra eyes growth above industry average as turnaround gains momentum
articles.summary: Mohit Joshi, Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of Tech Mahindra, said margin expansion continues to be a key focus for the company, which remains on track to achieve its 15% operating margin target by FY27.

articles.title: Tata Technologies confident of double-digit topline growth in FY27
articles.summary: Warren Kevin Harris, MD and CEO of Tata Technologies, said margins are expected to improve in the fourth quarter, with the company targeting a return to around 18%, in line with FY25 levels, over the next financial year.

articles.title: Outlook 2026 | Healthcare — how data, AI, and next‑generation analytics are reshaping patient outcomes
articles.summary: The promise of healthcare in 2026 is clear: when data, AI, and next‑generation analytics work in harmony, they redefine what’s possible for patients and the way those possibilities are chosen, notes ZS' Regional Managing Principal, Mohit Sood.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence is making the global wealth gap even worse
articles.summary: According to a new Oxfam report, billionaire wealth increased three times faster in 2025 than the average annual rate over the previous five years. This period coincided with the AI-fueled stock market boom in the US.

articles.title: Varanasi police file 8 FIRs over alleged fake images of Manikarnika Ghat Project
articles.summary: Eight separate cases have been lodged in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi against those allegedly spreading AIgenerated images and misleading information on social media regarding the redevelopment work at the Manikarnika Ghat

articles.title: $600 billion investment in AI marks 'fastest large scale capital reallocation in modern history': WEF's Cathy Li
articles.summary: Cathy Li of the World Economic Forum also shared projections on the likely impact of artificial intelligence on the labour market.

articles.title: Tech wrap this week: Apple announces Creator Studio; Vivo, Redmi and Realme tease new products
articles.summary: From Apple’s Creator Studio launch to Google’s Veo update and new phones teased by Vivo, Redmi and Realme - here’s what changed in tech this week.

articles.title: OpenAI to test targeted ads in ChatGPT, stepping up revenue push
articles.summary: The ads will appear in the coming weeks for logged-in users of the free version of ChatGPT as well as a newer, lower-cost $8-a-month “Go” plan that first launched in India and is now expanding to the US, the company said Friday. The more expensive paid tiers of ChatGPT will remain free of ads.

articles.title: Tech hiring set to rise 12-15% in 2026: Adecco India
articles.summary: Overall tech hiring across permanent, temporary and contractual roles is set to rise 12-15% in 2026, adding nearly 1,25,000 new jobs as expansion continues across segments, according to workforce solutions provider Adecco India.

articles.title: West Bengal to push AI, data centres under ₹30,000-crore silicon valley project
articles.summary: West Bengal's IT sector is poised for a major expansion with investments of around ₹30,000 crore lined up in the state's flagship silicon valley project, IT secretary Shubhanjan Das said on Friday, outlining an aggressive push into artificial intelligence, data centres and global capability centres.

articles.title: US stands to gain most from AI, even as job risks grow over time: WEF Report
articles.summary: Chief economists see artificial intelligence delivering rapid growth gains with modest job losses over the next two years, but warn employment risks rise sharply over the next decade, a WEF survey shows.

articles.title: Anthropic names Microsoft executive Irina Ghose as MD for India
articles.summary: Ghose, who has nearly three decades of experience scaling tech operations, will help ensure Anthropic's India approach is "grounded in local insight".

articles.title: OpenAI, Microsoft lose last chance to avoid trial with Musk
articles.summary: US District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers refused to throw out Musk’s accusation that OpenAI breached its promise to operate as a charitable trust.

articles.title: Netflix inks global deal to stream Sony Pictures' films after theatrical window
articles.summary: Netflix will become the exclusive streaming destination of Sony Pictures' films following their theatrical runs and video-on-demand releases for the first 18 months, after which they will go to Disney.

articles.title: India at an AI inflection point, $15 bn investment to build data centres, cables, clean energy: Google’s Preeti Lobana
articles.summary: Google’s largest-ever investment in India will focus on creating the backbone for an AI-driven economy, spanning compute capacity, high-speed connectivity and renewable power, as the company positions itself for long-term growth alongside India’s digital ambitions.

articles.title: Wikipedia owner signs on Microsoft, Meta in AI content training deals
articles.summary: Wikimedia Foundation, the operator of the online encyclopedia, said it also signed on AI startup Perplexity and France's Mistral AI, among other firms, over the past year, having enlisted Meta and Amazon as partners previously.

articles.title: X tightens safety measures around Grok, won't let image editing of real people in revealing clothes
articles.summary: X has tightened controls on Grok, restricting image editing of real people in bikinis and limiting features to paid subscribers, reinforcing its zero tolerance for child sexual exploitation.

articles.title: Taiwan issues arrest warrant for OnePlus CEO Pete Lau: Who is he and what he is accused of
articles.summary: Taiwan’s prosecutors allege that Lau and OnePlus illegally recruited more than 70 Taiwanese engineers over the past decade without obtaining approval from Taiwanese authorities.

articles.title: India has a short window to transform for an AI-led future: Vishal Sikka
articles.summary: Vishal Sikka, Founder & CEO of Vianai, spoke about the impact of AI on entry-level jobs. He noted that companies have slowed the hiring of young professionals, but this approach is not sustainable in the long run. Young people remain the backbone of the future workforce.

articles.title: Instagram founder Mike Krieger to co-lead Anthropic's AI incubator Labs amid leadership reshuffle
articles.summary: Mike Krieger, co-founder of Instagram and Anthropic’s Chief Product Officer (CPO) for the past two years, will step away from his C-suite role to co-lead Labs alongside Ben Mann, Anthropic's product engineering lead. Read on:

articles.title: Meta begins job cuts as it shifts gears from VR to AI wearables
articles.summary: With this, the Facebook-owner is stepping scaling down its efforts on Virtual Reality (VR) and "metaverse-first" vision which created a lot of buzz during the pandemic and prompted the tech giant to rename itself as Meta in October 2021. The Reality Labs, created around the same time, has lost more than $70 billion since then.

articles.title: Apple unveils Creator Studio: What is it and who is it for
articles.summary: The suite, available on the App Store from January 28, offers a range of professional-grade tools, including Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, Pixelmator Pro, Motion, Compressor, and MainStage.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu to set up India's first Sovereign AI Park: What it offers
articles.summary: Tamil Nadu and Sarvam AI signed an MoU to launch India’s first Sovereign AI Park, investing ₹10,000 crores to boost AI jobs, research, and Tamil-first digital innovation.

articles.title: US approves Nvidia H200 chip exports to China with some conditions
articles.summary: Trump administration approved Nvidia H200 AI chip sales to China with export caps, and security checks, sparking debate over US national security and enforcement challenges.

articles.title: SIP vs lump sum: What is best for you & how to time the market for higher returns
articles.summary: Lump sums excel in bull markets but carry higher risk; SIPs offer consistency and tax benefits. SIPs are generally preferred for long-term wealth, while lump sums can be used strategically during market dips.

articles.title: What to do if you receive an income tax notice
articles.summary: The Finance Act 2025 streamlines income tax notices with e-proceedings, DIN authentication, updated return options, and strict response timelines for taxpayers via the Income Tax Department portal.

articles.title: Common mistakes taxpayers make while filing ITR
articles.summary: From wrong ITR forms to unreported income and incorrect deductions, these frequent errors can delay processing and invite penalties, highlighting the need for careful filing and verification

articles.title: How your bonus, festive gifts are taxed | Explained
articles.summary: Under the Finance Act, 2025, all bonuses are taxable as salary under Section 17(1), with cash bonuses fully taxed and festive non-cash gifts exempt if below ₹5,000. Standard deduction is ₹75,000.

articles.title: AU SFB, ICSI sign pact for exclusive banking solutions for company secretaries
articles.summary: AU Small Finance Bank and Institute of Company Secretaries of India sign MoU to provide tailored banking, credit card solutions, and job opportunities for ICSI members nationwide.

articles.title: Budget 2026: How optional joint taxation for married couples could be a game-changer for households
articles.summary: Budget 2026 wishlist: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has proposed introduction of optional joint taxation for married couples, which could mark a significant shift in how personal income tax is structured.

articles.title: New income tax law: Old rulings may not apply automatically, says tax expert
articles.summary: The Indian government is set to implement the new Income Tax Act 2025 from April 1, 2026, replacing the current law that has been in effect since 1961.

articles.title: Understanding ESOPs: How they work and how they are taxed
articles.summary: ESOPs let employees buy company shares at a fixed price, boosting retention and wealth. Taxation applies at exercise, allotment, and sale, with deferral benefits for eligible startups.

articles.title: HDFC Infinia credit card rewards devalued: Here's what changes from Jan 16
articles.summary: HDFC Bank will cut Infinia credit card rewards on SmartBuy vouchers from 5X to 3X from 16 January 2026, reducing returns and aligning benefits with Biz Black and Diners Club Black cards.

articles.title: Axis Mutual Fund sees opportunity in state G-secs, credit accruals, and tax-efficient funds
articles.summary: Financial expert Devang suggests investors with a higher risk appetite can explore tactical opportunities in fixed income. He points to the attractive spreads in state government securities, accessible via Gilt funds with a 3-7 year duration. Additionally, he highlights the potential for higher yields in accrual-focused funds that invest in AA-rated bonds, offering a significant premium over their AAA-rated counterparts.

articles.title: Paripoorna Mediclaim Ayush Bima launched: What CGHS beneficiaries need to know
articles.summary: The Department of Financial Services (DFS) has rolled out an optional mediclaim cover for Central Government Health Scheme (CGHS) beneficiaries, offering higher coverage, cashless care and discounts. Read on for more details

articles.title: Investing in SIP: How returns grow over 10-20 years
articles.summary: SIPs enforce good investment discipline and harness the power of compounding in the most effective way. We break down how SIPs work and why staying invested matters more than timing the market.

articles.title: RBL Bank cuts interest rates on savings account deposits by 50 basis points; Details here
articles.summary: The interest rates on slabs less than ₹25 lakh and above ₹3 crore have been left unchanged by the lender, as per the details available on its website.

articles.summary: From early experiments in OCR to building Bajaj General Insurance’s GenAI-driven ecosystem, Avinash Naik’s journey reveals how technology and imagination are together redefining the future of financial services.

articles.summary: From anime-inspired curiosity to AI-powered credit systems, Karthikeyan Krishnaswamy is building the future of digital lending at KreditBee -- where technology serves business, and innovation drives inclusion.

articles.title: 2care.ai aims to transform chronic care management in India through WhatsApp
articles.summary: Healthtech startup 2care.ai combines WhatsApp and AI to simplify cancer care, organising health data, tracking treatment, and supporting patients between appointments.

articles.title: Ola Electric appoints Deepak Rastogi as CFO, Abichandani steps down
articles.summary: Rastogi brings more than three decades of experience across capital-intensive sectors, including automotive, manufacturing, chemicals, mining, and real estate, the company said.

articles.summary: From human-centric automation to smart manufacturing, Harsh Vardhan is guiding Apollo Tyres to an intelligent, AI-powered future.

articles.summary: Explore how local businesses thrive through trust, consistency, and community connections, proving success doesn’t always need social media hype.

articles.title: What one million interviews taught FloCareer about hiring at enterprise scale
articles.summary: After conducting over one million interviews, Mohit Jain, Co-founder, FloCareer shares key insights on why enterprise hiring is less about speed and more about structure, consistency, and decision quality at scale.

articles.title: AI, authenticity, and the creator’s edge: Lessons from Varun Mayya
articles.summary: After 13 years of building, Varun Mayya explains how human voice, brand trust, and mental resilience—not clones—will define the next phase of the creator economy.

articles.title: Reliance's Ajio focuses on speed, scales Ajio Rush to 420 pincodes
articles.summary: As the fashion ecommerce space becomes a three-way race, Reliance's Ajio is betting on faster deliveries and higher bill values. Ajio Rush now covers 420 pincodes across 10 cities, mirroring rivals Myntra and Nykaa's play on faster deliveries.

articles.title: Unbox Robotics raises $28M in Series B round led by ICICI Venture
articles.summary: This funding, comprising a mix of primary and secondary capital, will be utilised towards strengthening the leadership and engineering teams, accelerating new product development, and expanding market presence across India and select international markets.

articles.title: A Gonda workshop’s journey from manual repairs to digital diagnostics
articles.summary: For nearly two decades, Iqbal Ahmed has been fixing vehicles in Dhanepur, Gonda district, learning his trade in the slow, practical way

articles.title: Pitch Arena 2026: A Platform for Startup Fundraising and Growth
articles.summary: Pitch Arena 2026 connects startups with top investors via Elevate and PitchFest tracks. Apply now to fundraise and grow.

articles.title: Whizzo raises $15M in Series A round led by Fundamentum to deepen R&D
articles.summary: Whizzo will use the capital to expand its science and engineering teams, invest in fundamental research, and deepen its manufacturing partnerships as it scales its technical textiles platform globally.

articles.title: Shadowfax CEO on navigating the gig work efficiency puzzle ahead of IPO
articles.summary: Shadowfax is betting on its unique unified app that lets riders toggle between delivery formats to maximise hourly earnings. As the company's Rs 1,907 crore IPO opens today, its logistics play is built on the back of India's largest crowdsourced last-mile delivery fleet.

articles.title: M&E pushes for growth enablement; Ajio’s need for speed
articles.summary: The media and entertainment sector wants Budget 2026–27 to shift policy from regulation to growth enablement. Reliance's Ajio is betting on faster deliveries and higher bill values. EON Space Labs is building state-of-the-art electro-optical and infrared imagers in India.

articles.title: At Davos, SandboxAQ CEO outlines India’s AI opportunity
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is no longer optional for businesses and governments but essential for survival, according to SandboxAQ CEO Jack Hidary, who says India is well placed to use AI to scale globally, strengthen cybersecurity and build its own intellectual property.

articles.title: Startup news and updates: daily roundup (January 19, 2026)
articles.summary: YourStory presents the daily news roundup from the Indian startup ecosystem and beyond. Here's the roundup for Monday, January 19, 2026.

articles.title: LNK Energy eyes green hydrogen entry in next 3-5 years
articles.summary: The company, launched on the sidelines of WEF in Davos, is exploring multiple technologies and closely tracking market developments for green hydrogen even as solar manufacturing remains the immediate priority.

articles.title: Power Ministry seeks to oversee civil nuclear energy development
articles.summary: This move comes ahead of the Shanti Act s promulgation, which allows limited private participation in the nuclear sector. Currently, the Department of Atomic Energy oversees nuclear power matters.

articles.title: HPCL signs 10-year LNG supply pact with ADNOC Gas subsidiary
articles.summary: Long-term agreement to source LNG from UAE to support refineries, CGD networks and industrial demand via Chhara terminal

articles.title: ReNew lines up $500-million dollar bond issue
articles.summary: The funds will be utilised for on-lending within the ReNew Group, debt repayment, and other permitted corporate activities. Several major international banks are involved as joint global coordinators and bookrunners for this transaction.

articles.title: GMDC receives indigenous rare earth processing technology from BARC for Ambadungar project
articles.summary: Technology is designed to recover Mixed Rare Earth Concentrate (MREC) from the Ambadungar hard-rock ankeritic ore.

articles.title: Railways speeds up shift towards engines run on battery, green fuel
articles.summary: Following the substantial electrification of the railway network, the national transport authority is set to phase out the remaining diesel engines. Initial changes will be seen in yard operations, shunting, and last-mile freight tasks.

articles.title: Engineers India wins over $350 million Dangote refinery expansion mandate in Nigeria
articles.summary: EIL will act as PMC and EPCM consultant for second train of Dangote’s Lekki refinery, expanding capacity from 650,000 bpd to 1.4 million bpd.

articles.title: Indian Oil, Nayara lift Russian crude as RIL skips; IOC accounts for 43% of January imports
articles.summary: Indian Oil and Nayara Energy are now the main purchasers, boosting their intake. Reliance Industries has stopped all Russian crude supplies. This shift is prompting Russian suppliers to offer deeper discounts on their oil.

articles.title: Reliance Industries Q3 FY26 profit largely flat at ₹22,290 crore
articles.summary: Revenue rose 10% year-on-year to ₹2.94 lakh crore, supported by stronger oil-to-chemicals margins and volumes, while lower production and realisations weighed on the oil and gas segment.

articles.title: From party worker to its president: Nitin Nabin becomes BJP's youngest chief — 10 things to know
articles.summary: The BJP on Monday declared Nabin as its sole candidate for the post after the nomination and scrutiny process concluded without any rival contenders. This cleared the path for his unopposed election as the party’s 12th national president. In a late-night statement, BJP National Returning Officer K. Laxman said that only Nabin’s name remained after the completion of nominations and the withdrawal window, confirming his election by consensus.

articles.title: Punjab government approves modernisation of bus terminals in five districts
articles.summary: Punjab is set to modernize its major bus terminals in Ludhiana, Jalandhar, Sangrur, Patiala, and Bathinda through a Public Private Partnership. This initiative aims to significantly enhance passenger facilities, safety, and overall efficiency at these vital transport hubs. The upgrades will focus on improved waiting areas, sanitation, accessibility, and integrated commercial spaces, ensuring better connectivity for millions daily.

articles.title: Tobacco puts 1 in 10 at oral cancer risk among Nicobarese in India
articles.summary: A study on Car Nicobar Island revealed that nearly 10% of Nicobarese adults have oral lesions potentially leading to cancer, primarily linked to high smokeless tobacco and alcohol consumption. Researchers found these concerning rates concentrated within this specific community, highlighting urgent needs for targeted screening and cessation programs.

articles.title: Hope against Chikungunya: ICMR steps in as cases rise across India
articles.summary: The Indian Council of Medical Research is fast-tracking an experimental RNA-based antiviral therapy for Chikungunya, inviting Indian companies to develop and manufacture it. Developed by ICMR's National Institute of Virology, the therapy showed complete viral suppression in pre-clinical studies by targeting essential viral genes.

articles.title: Alcohol, sugary drinks stay cheap in India as WHO flags weak taxes in South-East Asia
articles.summary: The WHO warns that alcohol and sugar-sweetened beverages are becoming more affordable in India due to weak tax designs, failing to curb consumption despite strong health links. This public-health failure is leading to rising rates of liver disease, diabetes, and other chronic illnesses, particularly among younger populations.

articles.title: High drama in Tamil Nadu assembly: Governor R N Ravi walks out; alleges 'national anthem insulted'
articles.summary: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi staged a walkout from the state assembly, citing disrespect for the National Anthem and his microphone being switched off. Raj Bhavan alleged the speech ignored critical issues like Dalit atrocities. This marks a repeat of a similar incident last year, intensifying political tensions ahead of upcoming elections.

articles.title: Nitin Nabin sole candidate in fray for BJP president’s post, all set to take over today
articles.summary: Nitin Nabin is set to become the BJP's national president, emerging as the sole candidate with widespread backing from top party leaders, including PM Modi. This marks a historic moment as the party's president has always been a consensus choice.

articles.title: UK court seeks Delhi HC help in Nirav Modi’s bank fraud case trial
HC refuses to suspend Sengar jail term in custody death case
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court denied suspended jail term for expelled BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar in the custodial death case of the Unnao rape survivor's father. The court cited the grave nature of the offense, Sengar's criminal history, and the trial court's findings, emphasizing that the delay in trial was partly due to Sengar's legal team's actions.

articles.title: Abusive words alone not SC/ST Act offence: SC
SC directs govt to frame SOP for mentally ill homeless
SC seeks govt stand on AC rail fare cut for acid attack survivors
articles.summary: The Supreme Court has asked the government to respond to a Public Interest Litigation seeking concessional AC train fares for acid attack survivors. The NGO 'Atijeevan Society' argues that survivors, often from weaker economic backgrounds, need AC travel for frequent medical treatments but cannot afford it.

articles.title: HC bins I-T notices to NDTV founders, imposes 2L cost
Indian student enrolments in US down 75% in 1st yr of Trump 2.0
Change The Soch: 21-city drive to boost women's finance literacy
Bangladesh lets China envoy go close to Chicken’s Neck
articles.summary: Chinese Ambassador Yao Wen visited a Teesta project area in Bangladesh, signaling China's keenness to implement the Teesta Master Plan. This visit occurs amidst strained India-Bangladesh relations and follows discussions on development cooperation, including the Teesta project and a proposed friendship hospital.

articles.title: EC to showcase SIR as step to strengthen electoral process
articles.summary: India is hosting the International Conference on Democracy and Election Management in January 2026, bringing together nearly 100 delegates from 70 countries. The Election Commission will showcase its intensive electoral roll revision initiative, despite opposition concerns. The event will feature discussions on global electoral issues, best practices, and the launch of the ECINET digital platform.

articles.title: CBI quizzes TVK chief for second time in stampede case
articles.summary: TVK chief Vijay was questioned for seven hours by the CBI regarding the Karur stampede case, marking his second appearance. He was asked about rally permissions and adherence to guidelines. Vijay reportedly cited inadequate crowd control and police bottlenecks as contributing factors to the incident that claimed 41 lives.

articles.title: CISF to kick off 25-day cyclothon on Jan 28; 130 to take part
articles.summary: A contingent of 130 CISF personnel, including 65 women, will embark on a 6,553-km coastal cycling expedition across India's mainland coastline for 25 days starting January 28. This initiative aims to raise awareness about coastal security threats and foster national unity, coinciding with the 150th anniversary of 'Vande Mataram'.

articles.title: Asian stocks today: Markets trade mostly in red; Nikkei sheds 1%, HSI remains flat
articles.summary: Asian markets opened lower Tuesday amid renewed trade tensions and political developments in Japan. Investors reacted to US President Trump's tariff threats and a potential parliamentary dissolution in Japan, which boosted government bond yields. Attention now shifts to US corporate earnings and inflation data ahead of the Federal Reserve's meeting.

articles.title: Gold price prediction today: Will gold & silver prices continue to climb new highs? What investors should watch out for
articles.summary: Gold price prediction today: Praveen Singh of Mirae Asset Sharekhan says that gold prices may have faced downward pressure in the near term, had it not been for the heightened geopolitical tensions. Here’s his outlook on gold prices:

articles.title: Budget 2026 income tax: What middle class, salaried taxpayers want from FM Sitharaman - top wishlist
articles.summary: Budget 2026 expectations: The government had in the past considered the option of one uniform ITR form for all taxpayers, to make tax filing simpler and user friendly. It is desirable that the same be re-evaluated.

articles.title: India-UAE energy ties boost: ADNOC and HPCL seal $2.5 billion gas deal; New Delhi to receive half a million tonnes of LNG annually
articles.summary: India and the UAE have inked a significant energy pact, with ADNOC Gas agreeing to supply Hindustan Petroleum with over $2.5 billion worth of liquefied natural gas annually for ten years. This deal positions India as ADNOC Gas's largest customer.

articles.title: Shadowfax raises Rs 856cr from anchors
Ceat gains traction in Europe: CEO
Ola Electric CFO exits, co names successor
IMF raises FY26 growth forecast to 7.3% from 6.6%
Eyeing 'organic growth' in southern states: PNB chief
articles.summary: Punjab National Bank is prioritizing organic growth in southern states, with no acquisition plans currently on the table. The bank reported strong quarterly profits and anticipates improved net interest margins. Deposit and advance growth remain on track, and PNB expects a dip in gross NPAs below 3% by March.

articles.title: Another Rs 10.5k cr on table, Ikea to boost store count
India Inc gears up to deal with sanctions risk
articles.summary: India Inc is elevating sanctions risk to a top priority due to global instability and supply chain issues. Companies are increasingly seeking expert help to manage the disruptive impact, as sanctions now directly affect finances, vendors, and reputation.

articles.title: Wealth-tech startup AssetPlus raises '175cr
LTIMindtree revenue rises 6.1% to $1.2bn
RBI revises priority sector norms to include NCDC
articles.summary: The RBI has revised priority sector lending norms, now allowing loans to the National Cooperative Development Corporation to qualify. This aims to expand credit for cooperative societies, especially in agriculture, while simultaneously tightening compliance to prevent double counting of benefits.

articles.title: Rating agencies to zoom in on IPO funds' end-use
Wanted: Fresh graduates with AI, data skills
articles.summary: Tech firms are shifting from volume hiring to skills-led recruitment, narrowing fresher intake to specialized roles. Companies are offering significantly higher packages, ranging from Rs 16 lakh to Rs 55 lakh, for niche positions in AI, data engineering, and cybersecurity, reflecting a growing demand for specialized talent.

articles.title: Government readies $1bn package to give fillip to footwear manufacturing
Russia witnesses record winter: Entire neighbourhoods buried under mountain of snow — watch
articles.summary: Kamchatka Peninsula in Russia is grappling with unprecedented snowfall, burying homes and roads under metres of snow. Record-breaking storms have paralyzed daily life, with drifts reaching up to five metres. Authorities have declared a state of emergency after two fatalities, and avalanche risks are high. Transport remains severely disrupted as residents battle extraordinary winter conditions.

articles.title: “Terrible ideas”: Candace Owens blasts TPUSA legal letter claim as Erika Kirk and YouTuber fuel fresh controversy
articles.summary: Candace Owens criticized Turning Point USA after YouTuber Zach De Gregorio claimed the group sent him a cease and desist letter.
